oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1958-no-date Exhibit "D"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: correspondence; libraries; civil rights; desegregation; Lockard, H. T.; Randolph, Wassell; Turner, Jesse H.; 1950s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A letter from library board president Wassell Randolph to attorney H.T. Lockard, stating that the board voted to uphold their original decision that denied Mr. Turner's application. The letter also states that the board is preparing to take bids on construction of an addition to Cossitt Library which will be for Negro use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Randolph, Wassel
